alert.note: Alert for Arches, Grand Flat; Canyonlands, Natural Bridges; Eastern Uinta Basin; Southeast Utah (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Freeze Warning issued April 12 at 1:49PM MDT until April 14 at 9:00AM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 AM MDT WEDNESDAY... ...FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM WEDNESDAY TO 9 AM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the first Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 22 expected. For the second Freeze Warning, sub- freezing temperatures as low as 24 expected. * WHERE...In Utah, Southeast Utah, Eastern Uinta Basin, Arches/Grand Flat and Canyonlands/Natural Bridges. In Colorado, Grand Valley. * WHEN...For the first Freeze Warning, from 9 PM this evening to 11 AM MDT Wednesday. For the second Freeze Warning, from 9 PM Wednesday to 9 AM MDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.

area.areaDesc: Arches, Grand Flat; Canyonlands, Natural Bridges; Eastern Uinta Basin; Southeast Utah
